channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Google is betting on carbon capture tech to lower data center emissions. Here’s how it works
item.description: As AI data centers spring up across the country, their energy demand and resulting greenhouse gas emissions are raising concerns. With servers and ene...

item.title: I’m a founder: here’s why I spend my holidays at the doctor’s office
item.description: Fluorescent lights that softly hum. Magazines nobody reads. A television mounted in the corner playing cable news as a receptionist mispronounces my l...

item.title: JetBlue Adds Lounge Access: How it Compares to Competitors
item.description: JetBlue’s new BlueHouse lounge, now open at JFK airport, is designed as a hyper-local respite for the airline’s most loyal travelers.

item.title: Tesla’s ‘Mad Max Mode’ Points to a Big Problem for Self-Driving Cars
item.description: Tesla made Mad Max mode available briefly in 2018 and then reintroduced it in October. It contradicts a core promise of self-driving cars.

item.title: ‘Precarious’ is Wall Street’s defining word for 2026
item.description: Labor market softness, recession fears, AI bubbles and Fed questions are all top of mind as Wall Street heads into 2026.

item.title: The AI startups founders and VCs say could be acquisition targets in 2026
item.description: Some businesses have the tools and track records that tech giants crave.

item.title: The Shifts Needed to Make Employees Feel Less Isolated and More Supported in a Digital-First World
item.description: The most connected workforce is also the most isolated.

item.title: How the Nex Playground game system became the holiday’s hottest toy
item.description: The best-selling video game console this Black Friday was the PlayStation 5. That surprised no one. The number-two spot went to the Nintendo Switch 2....

item.title: American workers had a rough 2025. Will 2026 be any different?
item.description: It’s been a rough year for American workers. Unfortunately, 2026 isn’t looking all that much better. The year began with tariffs —just as inflation wa...

item.title: Opiate for the Masses: You Can Now Tell Your OpenAI ‘ChatBuddy’ To Be Less Mean To You
item.description: AI is not your friend, and that needs to be made clear before it becomes your enemy

item.title: Expedia CEO Ariane Gorin on the fight to ensure AI doesn’t turn her brands into invisible pipes consumers never see
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: Trump just declared Christmas Eve a national holiday. Here’s what’s open and closed?
item.description: It's one of two new holidays he announced.

item.title: CEOs reveal their New Year’s resolutions for 2026: From 8-day bike races and AI training, to finally cracking 7 hours of sleep a night
item.description: Beyond the boardroom, CEOs are setting goalposts for their own growth. Here’s what execs are hoping to achieve in 2026.

item.title: Young people are lying about work to their families at the holidays
item.description: To quote Vince Vaughn in Four Christmases : “You can’t spell ‘families’ without ‘lies.’” That’s a cynical view, for sure, but when it comes to talking...

item.title: If Mom Wants Her Christmas Stocking Filled, Should She Have to Ask?
item.description: A viral Instagram video sparked a debate about emotional labor.
